name: MCSA Windows Server 2016 - 70-TBA
subtitle: Installing and Configuring Windows Server 2012
description: Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The MCSA: Windows Server covers topics that are “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows servers in a corporate or enterprise environment. Server systems often form a critical piece of the day-to-day operations for any business. The MCSA covers topics that will help the learner ensure their computing environment is functional and stable.

episodes.title: Plan for a Server 2016 Installation
episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Daniel explore the many options available for installing Microsoft Windows Server 2016. They begin by looking at the basic requirements for installing Server 2016 with Desktop Experience. Then move on to do the same with Server 2016(Core) and the new Server Nano installation options.

episodes.title: Installing Server 2016
episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Daniel walk you through installing Microsoft Windows Server 2016. They start by installing Server 2016 with the Desktop Experience. Then they go back through installing, this time using the "Server 2016" option.

episodes.title: Installing Server 2016 Nano Server
episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Daniel show you how to install Microsoft Server 2016 Nano Server. They begin by explaining exactly what Nano Server is along with its philosophy of use; roles like name resolution(DNS), Web server(IIS), and Hyper-V platforms. Then they take you through installing the Nano Server steps which includes using the PowerShell environment.

episodes.title: Configuring Server 2016 Core
episodes.description: In this episode, Mike and Daniel take you through common configuration options when deploying Server 2016 (Core). They show you how to Rename, set the time zone/time, set the IP address, set the DNS information, join a domain, and enable remote management.

episodes.title: Configure Local Storage
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike go over the important topic of Local Storage in the Windows Server 2016 environment. They start with disk drive basics like adding/initializing a drive, partitioning, and setting the disk type (MBR or GPT, dynamic or basic). They also show you how to manage drive volumes and configure stripes and mirrors for performance and redundancy respectively.

episodes.title: Configuring File Access
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike explain how to properly grant file access using NTFS permissions. They begin by detailing exactly what permissions are available and what they do as well as how to apply them. Then they take a look at inheritance of permissions. Finally, they explain how to discern Effective Access and which permissions get precedence.

episodes.title: Configuring Share Access
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike explain how to properly grant file access over the network using share permissions. They begin by detailing exactly what share permissions are available and what they do as well as how to apply them. They also show you how to understand effective permissions when mixing share and NTFS permissions and then create shares in a myriad of ways.

episodes.title: Configuring Share Access Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike finish their discussion on configuring Share access in Windows Server 2016. Here they walk you through working with Offline Files as well as demonstrating how to configure the Volume Shadow Copy Service which allows you to keep previous versions of files around for recovery purposes.

episodes.title: Configuring Remote Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to configure remote management for the different installations of Microsoft Server 2016. They start with Server 2016 Desktop Experience and then on to 2016 "Core", using the built-in Server Manager, allowing them to have a local graphical tool to make administrative changes on the remote machine.

episodes.title: Configure Remote Management Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to configure remote management for the different installations of Microsoft Server 2016. They start with Server 2012 and then on to Server 2008, using the built-in Server Manager, allowing them to have a local graphical tool to make administrative changes on the remote machine.

episodes.title: Configure Remote Management Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to configure remote management for the different installations of Microsoft Server 2016. They start with Server 2016 that is apart of a Workgroup and not a domain; they use the built-in Server Manager, which allows them to have a local graphical tool to make administrative changes on the remote machine.

episodes.title: Create and Configure VM Settings
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike explore Hyper-V virtual machines and their settings. They discuss the various settings that can be configured on the host machine as well as the settings that can be configured on the guest machines.

episodes.title: Create and Configure VM Settings Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of Hyper-V virtual machines and their setting. They discuss the various settings that can be configured on the host machine as well as the settings that can be configured on the guest machines.

episodes.title: Create and Configure VM Settings Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of Hyper-V virtual machines and their setting. They discuss the various settings that can be configured on the host machine as well as the settings that can be configured on the guest machines.

episodes.title: Create and Configure VM Storage
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike demonstrate how to configure storage to support VMs inside of Hyper-V. They discuss the different disk type, including the VHD, VHDX file formats as well as the difference between fixed, dynamic and differencing disks.

episodes.title: Create and Configure VM Storage Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike demonstrate how to configure storage to support VMs inside of Hyper-V. They discuss the concept of pass-through disks and describe the benefits of them. They explore using checkpoints to roll back VM changes to a previous state. They will also look at setting up virtualized Fibre-Channel adapters as well as the consideration when using them.

episodes.title: Create and Configure Virtual Networks
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike explore configuring virtual networks through the Hyper-V Manager. They discuss the different types of virtual switches that can be created such as internal, external and private. They demonstrate static and dynamic MAC addresses management.

episodes.title: Create and Configure Virtual Networks Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their discussion on configuration of virtual networks through the Hyper-V Manager. They discuss the different types of virtual switches that can be created such as internal, external and private. They demonstrate static and dynamic MAC addresses management.

episodes.title: Configure IPv4 and IPv6 Addressing
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike explore the world of IP addressing. They explain the TCP/IP model, IPv4, IPv6 addresses, their types as well as TCP/IP sockets and ports.

episodes.title: Configure IPv4 and IPv6 Addressing Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of the world of IP addressing. They describe the states an IPv6 address can go through it’s lifecycle as well as demonstrate some of the cmdlets in Powershell that can be used to configure IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

episodes.title: Configure IPv4 and IPv6 Addressing Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their exploration of the world of IP addressing. They will discuss transition technologies that allows networks that are IPv4 only to send IPv6 traffic.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DHCP
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to deploy and configure Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol(DHCP) as a service in Windows Server 2016. They start by explaining what DHCP is and how it works. Then they show you how to install and authorize the DHCP role in Server 2016.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DHCP Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue deploying and configuring DHCP in Windows Server 2016. They pick back up by creating a DHCP scope that clients will receive their TCP/IP information from. They also look at setting the scope options which are all the details of the TCP/IP information that's being given to the client, and scope reservations.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DHCP Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike move forward with more DHCP server configuration in Windows Server 2016. First they finish looking at DHCP options, specifically Scope, Server, Class, and Reservation options. They also look at PXE booting and using a Relay Agent to send DHCP info across broadcast domains.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DHCP Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike finish their explanation of DHCP in Windows Server 2016. The start things off by discussing the DHCP database. They show you where the database resides on the system and how to customize the automated backup process. Finally they demonstrate the DORA process using the packet capture software Wireshark.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DNS
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike take a look at deploying and configuring the Domain Name Service(DNS) in Windows Server 2016. They start with a DNS primer to explain DNS basic concepts. Then they take a look at the record types and how they are used and created.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DNS Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue exploring DNS in Windows Server 2016. They begin here by introducing you to the details of Zones and the types of Zones you'll encounter. This includes Primary, Secondary, and Active Directory Integrated Zones.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DNS Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike are back with more DNS in Windows Server 2016, this time they take us out of DNS servers we control and explain how we get DNS information for servers that we don't control. This is done using the 13 Root DNS servers. They also explain recursive and iterative queries as well as how Root Hints are employed.

episodes.title: Deploy and Configure DNS Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike finish up their dissertation on DNS in Windows Server 2016. They pick back up with DNS forwarders which helps "outsource" DNS lookups to another DNS server. They also tackle DNS caching which is used to speed up DNS lookups. Finally they take a look at Stub Zones.

episodes.title: Installing Domain Controllers
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to install the Active Directory Services role and then promote a server to Domain Controller status. They walk you through the ADDS Wizard from start to finish, highlighting important options like the Domain and Forest Functional Levels.

episodes.title: Install Domain Controllers Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to install the Active Directory Services role and then promote a server to Domain Controller status. This time they are doing all of this from the PowerShell for a Server 2016 "Core" type of environment. They also show you how to "Install From Media" or IFM which helps to quickly create new domain controllers in an existing domain.

episodes.title: Create and Manage User Accounts
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike look at creating and managing user account in Active Directory using Windows Server 2016. They begin creating user accounts using the Graphical User Interface. They then look at all the attributes of the newly created account and explain all the common elements that you need to be familiar with. Then they show you how to delete and/or copy a user account, as well as utilize a template.

episodes.title: Create and Manage User Accounts Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue looking at creating and managing user account in Active Directory using Windows Server 2016. They begin creating user accounts using the PowerShell. They also show you how to use the GUI and the PowerShell to perform bulk operations.

episodes.title: Create and Manage Computer Accounts
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to create and manage computer accounts using Windows Server 2016 in a Microsoft Active Directory Domain. They start by explaining what a computer account is and the requirements for creating one in AD and then create a computer account in AD by joining a computer to the domain. Then they show you how to "pre-stage" computer account.

episodes.title: Create and Manage Computer Accounts Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue their discussion on computer accounts and joining computers to an Active Directory domain. The start by showing you how to un-join a computer from a domain and then how to join an offline PC to a domain. Finally, they show you how to fix a computer account that has lost its trust with the domain.

episodes.title: Active Directory Groups
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike introduce to the exciting world of Active Directory Groups in Windows Server 2016. They start by explaining what a group is and why we use them. Then they describe the different group types and scopes and when to use each based off of Microsoft's best practices.

episodes.title: Active Directory Groups Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue their discussion and demonstration of Active Directory Groups, here picking up by taking what we've learned so far and creating our own custom groups using the GUI and PowerShell. Then they show you how to enumerate and modify group membership.

episodes.title: Active Dirctory Organizational Units
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike introduce you to working with Organization Units in Active Directory. They begin by explaining the difference between a built-in AD Container and OUs and then create custom OUs for the purposes of giving an AD environment some structure. They also show you how to configure delegation of administrative tasks by using the Delegation Wizard.

episodes.title: Group Policy Objects
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike delve into Group Policy and Group Policy Objects in Windows Server 2016. They start by explaining what GPOs are and why they are so important to controlling an Active Directory environment. Then they show you how to configure the Central Store to share an administrative template. Then they show you how to expand GPO functionality by importing new administrative templates.

episodes.title: Group Policy Objects Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike finish their exposition of Group Policy in Windows Server 2016. Here they explain what Starter GPOs are and how you can leverage them in your domain. Then they show you how to configure GPO links to either enable or disable them, as well as touch on inheritance. Finally, they show you the 4 different Local Group Policies which includes Local Computer, Administrators, Non-Administrators, and User-Specific.

episodes.title: Configure Security Policies
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to start configuring security settings for your Domain in Windows Server 2016. They begin by looking at configuring User Rights Assignments, User Account Control, and Security Options found in Group Policy. Next, they show you how to utilize Security Templates. Finally, they show you how to monitor your environment through the Audit Policy.

episodes.title: Configure Security Policies Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue configuring security settings, specifically jumping back into the Audit Policy settings to create a new GPO with custom settings. Finally they show you how to control and configure Local Users and Groups using Group Policy.

episodes.title: Application Restriction Policies
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike show you how to tighten security by enforcing application restrictions in a Domain environment. They begin by explaining what exactly Application Restriction is and how to configure the rule enforcement and other AppLocker Rules. Also covered is Software Restriction policy configuration.

episodes.title: Configure Windows Firewall
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike explain how to configure the Windows Firewall. First they show you how that Firewall can be configured for multiple network profiles. Then they look at common connection security rules. Next they configure the Firewall to allow/deny applications, scopes, ports, and/or users. Finally, they show you how to import/export settings.

episodes.title: Configure Windows Firewall Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue exploring the Windows Firewall by showing you how to secure security rules for network connections using IPSec. And finally, they demonstrate how to create exceptions in the Firewall when working with authenticated users.

episodes.title: Configure Print and Document Services
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike dive into the realm of printers. They explain the benefits of using Windows Server 2016 as a print server, including centralized management of printer, Easy Print drivers, printer redirection, print pooling, print priorities and more.
